intro: Ophiorrhiza harrisiana var. merguensis, commonly known as the Merguens hill brier, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and woody stems. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, elliptical fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and is often found in humid tropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
